snippet: The debate has grown far larger than administration officials anticipated, with lawmakers of both parties and half of Americans calling for restraint.
abstract: News analysis; America's war on terrorism may end one day, but until that happens Pres Obama has given every indication that it will be fought in much the same way it has for nearly 12 years; Obama administration, in response to a vague yet ominous terror warning, shut down nearly two dozen American embassies and consulates and waged an intense drone campaign in Yemen, while voicing support for expansive communications monitoring to keep country safe.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and SCOTT SHANE
byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti reported from Washington, and Scott Shane from New York.

lead_paragraph: The debate has grown far larger than administration officials anticipated, with lawmakers of both parties and half of Americans calling for restraint.

headline.main: Threats Test Obama’s Balancing Act on Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Balancing Act Put to the Test
